title: UNESCO AI Readiness Assessment Methodology
description: Practical methodology that has engaged 58 governments worldwide to assess their readiness for AI adoption. Helps countries align with UNESCO's AI ethics recommendations whilst evaluating capacity across individual, institutional, and systemic levels, particularly valuable for developing countries.

title: Government AI Readiness Index 2024 (Oxford Insights)
description: Independent assessment of 188 countries' AI readiness across government, technology sector, and data infrastructure. Tracks regional progress including emerging strategies from Sub-Saharan Africa, South and Central Asia, and Latin America, with actionable insights for policymakers on identifying gaps and opportunities.

title: 'The Need for a Leapfrog Strategy' (Centre for Strategic & International Studies)
description: Analysis examining how countries like Rwanda and Kenya successfully enabled leapfrog development through regulatory flexibility and public-private partnerships. Emphasises that leapfrogging works as an enabler of sustainable development when supported by robust innovation ecosystems and good governance, not as a standalone solution.

title: What Does Technology Leapfrogging Really Mean for Africa? (CIO)
description: Contemporary analysis of leapfrogging across African countries, featuring the African Leapfrog Index ranking of Kenya, South Africa, Nigeria, Egypt, Rwanda, and Ethiopia. Discusses both opportunities and warnings about brain drain, emphasising the need for strategic rather than purely technological leapfrogging.

title: Africa Is Harnessing Technology to Leapfrog Towards Growth (World Economic Forum)
description: Recent analysis showing how countries like Mauritius, Rwanda, and Kenya are converting potential into prosperity through visionary leadership and targeted investment. Highlights Rwanda's Zipline drones reducing medical supply delivery times and Ghana's use of digital IDs and AI platforms for agricultural productivity, whilst noting persistent institutional barriers.

title: Handbook for Implementing Capacity Building Programmes for AI Policymakers
description: Practical guide for establishing peer-learning programmes on AI policy for national government policymakers in developing countries. Includes training content, delivery methodologies, and lessons from implementation, particularly relevant for building sustained institutional capability.

title: UNESCO - India Launches AI Competency Framework to Transform Public Service
description: Recent case study of India developing AI competency frameworks aligned with UNESCO's global vision, identifying essential skills for civil servants at every level. Demonstrates how absorptive capacity strategies enable governments to evaluate emerging technologies critically whilst customising solutions to local contexts.

title: GovInsider - Bangladesh's a2i Programme: From Aspiration to Agency
description: Case study of Bangladesh's digital transformation programme that provided institutional anchor for blending leapfrogging and absorptive capacity approaches. Demonstrates how over 2,000 government services were digitalised whilst building internal capabilities, saving citizens billions of dollars and establishing groundwork for AI-enhanced administration.
